prompt: Links to documentation, support, and contact page in the header

message.content:
Here's the design for the UI: **What should the UI look like?** The UI should have a simple and clean design with a prominent header section that contains links to documentation, support, and contact pages. The header should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. The UI should have a consistent color scheme and use highlight colors to make different parts of the UI stand out. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. **Header**: Standalone * Description: The header component will contain links to documentation, support, and contact pages. * Mobile: The header will take up the full width of the screen and will have a fixed height. * Tablet: The header will have a maximum width of 720px and will be centered on the screen. * Desktop: The header will have a maximum width of 1200px and will be centered on the screen. 2. **NavLink**: Takes Children * Description: The NavLink component will render a single link to a page. * Mobile: The link will be displayed as a block element and will take up the full width of the screen. * Tablet: The link will be displayed as an inline-block element and will have a minimum width of 100px. * Desktop: The link will be displayed as an inline-block element and will have a minimum width of 150px. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - **Header**: Standalone ```html
{children}
``` - **NavLink**: Takes Children ```html {label} ```

prompt: Section title component with a green underline

message.content:
1) The Section Title component should have a large font size, be centered, and have a green underline to draw attention to the title. It should be responsive, so on smaller screens, the font size and padding around the title should decrease. 2) **SectionTitle** (Takes Children): This component displays a title with a green underline. The title is centered on larger screens and has a larger font size. On smaller screens, the font size decreases and the padding around the title becomes tighter. 3) Top-level UI: ```html
{title}
``` 4) **SectionTitle** (Takes Children): ```html

prompt: A product card component with a rectangular image, product name, price, and rating

message.content:
Here's the design for the product card component: **What should the UI look like?** The product card component should have a clean and modern design, with a rectangular image at the top, followed by the product name, price, and rating. The image should be large enough to showcase the product, but not overwhelm the other information. The product name should be prominent and easy to read, with the price and rating displayed clearly below. The component should be responsive, with the image and text adjusting to fit different screen sizes. **Individual components:** 1. `ProductCard` (Takes Children): The top-level component that contains the image, product name, price, and rating. 2. `ProductImage` (Standalone): A rectangular image that showcases the product. 3. `ProductName` (Standalone): A heading that displays the product name. 4. `ProductPrice` (Standalone): A paragraph that displays the product price. 5. `ProductRating` (Standalone): A paragraph that displays the product rating. **Top-level UI HTML:** ```html {product_name} {price} {rating} ``` **Component HTML:** 1. `ProductCard` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` 2. `ProductImage` (Standalone): ```html ``` 3. `ProductName` (Standalone): ```html

{children}

``` 4. `ProductPrice` (Standalone): ```html

{children}

``` 5. `ProductRating` (Standalone): ```html

{children}

``` Note: I used Tailwind CSS classes to style the components. I also used placeholder values (`{image_url}`, `{product_name}`, `{price}`, `{rating}`) to represent the dynamic data that would be passed to the components.

prompt: A banner component that displays a large background image and overlay text

message.content:
Here is the design of the UI: **What should the UI look like?** The banner component should have a large background image that takes up the full width of the screen. On top of the background image, there should be overlay text that is centered both horizontally and vertically. The text should be large and bold to grab the user's attention. The background image should scale to fit different screen sizes, and the overlay text should adjust its font size accordingly. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * `Banner` component (Takes Children): The main banner component that contains the background image and overlay text. + On `xs` screens, the background image takes up the full width of the screen, and the overlay text is centered horizontally and vertically with a font size of `24px`. + On `md` screens, the background image takes up the full width of the screen, and the overlay text is centered horizontally and vertically with a font size of `36px`. + On `lg` screens, the background image takes up the full width of the screen, and the overlay text is centered horizontally and vertically with a font size of `48px`. + Purpose: To display a large background image with overlay text to grab the user's attention. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html ``` **What is the HTML for each component?** * `Banner` component (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note: `{background_image_url}` should be replaced with the URL of the background image, and `{children}` should be replaced with the overlay text.

prompt: A footer component, including links to About, Blog, and Help, as well as social media links

message.content:
Here is the design for the footer component: **1. What should the UI look like?** The footer component should be a clean and simple section that provides quick links to important pages and social media profiles. It should be easily accessible on all devices and screen sizes. **2. What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * Footer (Standalone): The footer component that contains all the links and social media profiles. * FooterLink (Takes Children): A single link component that can be used to create links to About, Blog, Help, and social media profiles. * SocialMediaLink (Takes Children): A single social media link component that can be used to create links to social media profiles. **Description of each component:** * Footer: The footer component should have a dark background color and a max width of 1200px on large screens. It should be centered horizontally and have a padding of 2rem on large screens and 1rem on smaller screens. It should have a subtle box shadow to give it some depth. * FooterLink: Each footer link should have a hover effect that changes the text color to a bright accent color. The text should be uppercase and have a font size of 1rem. * SocialMediaLink: Each social media link should have a hover effect that changes the icon color to a bright accent color. The icon should be a standard size of 1.5rem and have a margin of 0.5rem on the right. **3. What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
About Blog Help

Copyright {current_year} {site_name}

``` **4. What is the HTML for each component?** - Footer (Standalone): ```html
{children}
``` - FooterLink (Takes Children): ```html {children} ``` - SocialMediaLink (Takes Children): ```html {children} ```

prompt: A "Designer of the Month" section with a photo, name, and short bio

message.content:
Here's the design for the "Designer of the Month" section: **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a prominent display of the designer's photo, with their name and bio displayed prominently below. The design should be clean and modern, with a focus on showcasing the designer's information. The UI should scale well on different screen sizes, with the photo and text resizing to fit different devices. **Components** * DesignerProfile (Takes Children): A container component that holds the designer's photo, name, and bio. * ProfilePicture (Standalone): A component that displays the designer's photo. * DesignerInfo (Takes Children): A component that displays the designer's name and bio. **Top-Level HTML** ```html

{designer_bio}
``` **Component HTML** * DesignerProfile (Takes Children): ```html

prompt: A testimonial component with a quote, name, and photo

message.content:
Here's the design for a testimonial component: **What should the UI look like?** The testimonial component should have a clean and minimalistic design, with a focus on showcasing the quote, name, and photo of the person. The quote should be the central element, with a larger font size and a subtle gradient background to make it stand out. The name and photo should be displayed below the quote, with the photo being a circular image. The component should be responsive, with a layout that adapts to different screen sizes. **Components** * **Testimonial** (Takes Children): This component will contain the quote, name, and photo of the person. It will have a subtle gradient background and a circular image for the photo. * **Quote** (Standalone): This component will display the quote text with a larger font size and a subtle gradient background. * **Meta** (Takes Children): This component will display the name and photo of the person. **Top-level HTML** ```html {quote_text}

{name}

 ``` **Component HTML** * **Testimonial** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` * **Quote** (Standalone): ```html

{children}

``` * **Meta** (Takes Children): ```html

{name}

``` Note that I used Tailwind CSS classes to style the components. I also used placeholder values for `quote_text`, `photo_url`, and `name`, which will need to be replaced with actual values.

prompt: A loading indicator with a spinning wheel and a white background

message.content:
Here's the design and implementation of the loading indicator: **What should the UI look like?** The loading indicator should be a circular spinning wheel on a white background, indicating that the application is processing or loading data. The spinning wheel should be colored with a highlight color to make it stand out. The loading indicator should be centered on the screen, with a consistent padding on all sides to provide a clear visual hierarchy. **Individual components:** 1. **LoadingIndicator** (Standalone): * On small screens (sm:), the loading indicator should be 40px in diameter and centered on the screen with 16px padding on all sides. * On medium screens (md:), the loading indicator should be 48px in diameter and centered on the screen with 20px padding on all sides. * On large screens (lg:), the loading indicator should be 56px in diameter and centered on the screen with 24px padding on all sides. * The purpose of the LoadingIndicator is to indicate to the user that the application is processing or loading data. **Top-level HTML:** ```html
``` **Component HTML:** - LoadingIndicator (Standalone): ```html
``` Note: `{highlight_color}` is a placeholder for the highlight color, which can be replaced with a specific color code (e.g. `blue-500`) or a custom color variable.

prompt: Hero section with a high-quality image of a fit person exercising

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The hero section should be attention-grabbing, showcasing a high-quality image of a fit person exercising. The image should be responsive, scaling to fit different screen sizes. The section should have a modern, clean design with a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button. The hero section should also have a subtle gradient effect to add depth and dimension. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. **HeroImage** (Standalone): A full-width, responsive image component that showcases a high-quality image of a fit person exercising. * sm: Image takes up the full width of the screen with a height of 300px. * md: Image takes up the full width of the screen with a height of 400px. * lg: Image takes up the full width of the screen with a height of 500px. * xl: Image takes up the full width of the screen with a height of 600px. 2. **CallToAction** (Takes Children): A button component that encourages the user to take action. * sm: Button has a minimum width of 200px and a height of 40px. * md: Button has a minimum width of 250px and a height of 50px. * lg: Button has a minimum width of 300px and a height of 60px. * xl: Button has a minimum width of 350px and a height of 70px. **What is the HTML for the top level UI?** ```html
{cta_text}
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - **HeroImage** (Standalone): ```html ``` - **CallToAction** (Takes Children): ```html ```

prompt: Star rating component with 1-5 stars and a number of reviews

message.content:
Here's the design for the star rating component: **What should the UI look like?** The star rating component should display 1-5 stars, indicating the average rating, and show the number of reviews. The component should be compact and easy to read. On smaller screens, the component should be horizontal, and on larger screens, it should be vertical to save space. The star icons should be highlighted in a bright yellow color to draw attention. **Components** 1. **StarRating** (Takes Children): A compact component displaying 1-5 stars and a number of reviews. - On small screens (sm:), the component will be horizontal and takes up the full width. - On medium screens (md:) and above, the component will be vertical and takes up half the width. - The component will have a subtle shadow to give it depth. **Top Level UI** ```html ``` **Components' HTML** - StarRating (Takes Children): ```html
{stars}

{review_count} reviews

``` Note: The `stars` variable will be replaced with the actual star icons, and `review_count` will be replaced with the actual number of reviews.
